course_title: Special Topics: Cross-listed: Cooking with Shakespeare
class_notes:
Same as ENG 312W 1.
Shakespeare's plays include banquets, tavern meals, and references to newly traded herbs, spices, and exotic commodities.  We will read and write about food practices in Shakespeare's time and enjoy hands-on workshops. In our asynchronous classes, we will watch podcasts and films related to Tudor farming, kitchens, feasts, and times of famine. Students with kitchens will also cook! (alternative assignments available).
course_description: Selected topics in history for students in non-history originating (cross-listed) courses. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
sections: Class Nbr: 2317, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MTWThF 11a-12:30p, Instructor: S. Cavanagh, Status: Open
